intro: Durabaculum helix, commonly known as the spiral rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine environments. Durabaculum helix is a hardy species that is adapted to cold climates and can withstand harsh weather conditions.
